page.title: 13HEALTH IN WESTCOTT
page.content: The local{doctor}is{Dr McDonald {Watson.} At the{surgery}there are about{2,200 people}on the register. Out of this about twenty people attend the surgery each day. There are eight surgeries a week which are about one and a half hours long. Dr McDonald usually receives about three late night calls per month (six pm onwards). He also has about forty home calls per week. At the surgery there is a{pharmacy}being run by the doctor's wife and one assistant. The surgery has a pharmacy in it because the nearest chemist is two miles away in Dorking. There is also a{midwife service being run attached to the surgery. Patients come to the surgery from {Abinger, Gomshall, Dorking, Wotton}and the borders of{Betchworth.
